review.reviewBody: This bag is plenty spacious for multiple school books, a computer, and other daily essentials but you need to be creative in how you store your things in the main compartment because it is just like a dry sack bag with no other compartments or sleeves on the inside. The top pocket in front of the handle is very spacious and can hold most of your things you need to be easily accessible. The molly webbing going down the front of the bag is a nice touch and makes it easy to attach things along with the drawstring for holding things like wet clothes or shoes and stuff you don't want to mix with your things inside the bag. The side pockets have a lot of room and should fit even the biggest trendy expensive cups people drink out of nowadays. The material sheds water and if you roll the top tight the main compartment should be water proof unless submerged. The only thing that could make this bag better would be a laptop sleeve on the inside.
review.name: Nice all around bag

name: Mission Surf 35L Roll Top Pack

review.reviewBody:
Love the color matching to my frame, but this fails the basic task of a bottle cage in that it should not be launching bottles out of the cage. I have this on a gravel bike, and now three bottles have launched from the seat tube cage. Different types of bottles too - except a Tasx bottle which is tight enough in the cage. Anything else and it is loose enough that a good bounce will launch the bottle. Also, 750ml bottles are not great in the cage either. The way the cage is made the top half is too exposed and bottle comes out easily. Even with some silicone tape wrapped on the apex of the cage to hold the bottle in there are bottles that are still too lose - such as Purist bottles. I guess if you only have Tasx bottles you'll be okay. 

Sorry, Elite, but you had one job here, and it is a fail.
review.name: Fails the Most Basic Task.

name: T-Race Water Bottle Cage

review.itemreviewed: FLITE Boost Gravel TI316 Superflow Saddle
review.reviewBody:
This is a awesome saddle for aggressive riding. Not so much for long distance events. Everyone's anatomy is different, but my thighs would bump into the nose. Also would get chaffing on this saddle a lot. Have had a professional bikefit with this saddle and it just didn't work out. 

Awesome build and quality nonetheless!
review.name: A great saddle but for the right person

review.itemreviewed: FLITE Boost Gravel TI316 Superflow Saddle
review.reviewBody: It's stressful ordering an expensive saddle without being able to try it out first, but I am so glad I did!  The padding is firm and supportive, but adds a level of comfort I was really missing before.  I only wish I had ordered this sooner.
review.name: Saddle just disappears
comment: Really good saddle just not for my anatomy.

name: FLITE Boost Gravel TI316 Superflow Saddle

review.reviewBody: Great grip! Pointed, flat bottom toe makes it easy to get into crevices. Heel is great, can easily hang from most holds. Used on indoor bouldering mostly.
review.name: Favorite shoe so far!

review.reviewBody: As an intermediate climber I can say these are some of my favorite shoes.  Fit: I wear a size 9 - 9.5 running shoe in Asics, Brooks or Nike and the size 9 in these is perfect.  It fits a little tight until the material breaks in and then it's a glove for your foot.  That is how climbing shoes should fit.   PROS: I like to smear a lot even in places where other climbers think you can't.  These are the absolute best for that.  As an intro shoe they are comfortable and can be worn all day.  The rubber is super soft so it gets really good grip on any surfaces.  These shoe stick to the wall better than some of my $200 shoes.  Because they are flat instead of cambered you can use the ball of your foot or switch to inside of toe really easily instead of just toe poking the wall all the time.   CONS: The soft rubber also means that i wear these out after about a year and the soft rubber means edging is harder to do.  Not impossible but not what the shoe is best at.  The Stink! These shoes smell bad.  They call the line anti odor but that is the worst misnomer in history.  The liner traps in sweat.  None of my other shoes smell like this.  I have to spray them with disinfectant after every climb.
review.name: Awesome for smearing.  But STINK!

review.reviewBody: I use them nearly daily at the gym and on longer easy routes. They are not techy but they are precise for a comfortable shoe and I’ve been through about 5 pairs in my life. Several have been resoled and given me a few years before they died. I have other shoes for hard sport routes or thin cracks but if you want to hang out and crag all day on moderates these are perfect for what they are.
review.name: Perfect for what they are.

review.reviewBody: First timer buying climbing shoes and well I learned a quick lesson after ordering my first pair, they run small (very small) and each brand is very different. So please NOTE * I did not use this pair to climb in but only to find a pair that fit. Needless to say, I wear a size 8 in women's consistently and ordered a half size up (8.5) which is a 7.5 in mens and it was still too snug. I'd recommend ordering 1 full size up. A size 9 in women's would have probably been ideal. On backcountry's site this is considered a "unisex" shoe which uses men's sizing. I hope this helps.
review.name: Quick Guide To Find Size For You

review.reviewBody: Got these shoes for my adult son and he loves the shoe but I had to send them back to get a bigger size! Great shoe for indoor climbing!
review.name: Good Climbing Shoe: Def Order Up A Size

review.reviewBody: The only size 15 I could find, and it fits very well after having been broken in. Thank you for carrying my size!
review.name: Amazing shoe

review.reviewBody:
These shoes perform absolutely fine given their intended use/demographic, but it seems to me that Evolv is dealing with some sizing discrepancies that I would like to see sorted out.

The TL;DR here: I wear a Men's 11 in virtually all street shoes, but in this shoe I wear a size Men's 13 (out of the box, toes touching the ends but not quite curled over). If you are looking for shoes that fit similarly, my suggestions are as follows:
For your size in Women's street shoes, go with the same size or 1/2 a size up from what is listed as the Men's size on the Evolv Defy.
For your size in Men's street shoes, go 1.5 to 2 sizes bigger than what is listed as the Men's size on the Evolv Defy.
COMPLETELY ignore the EU and UK sizes.

Compared to the Evolv Titan, this shoe is exactly 1.5 sizes smaller (the typical men's to women's size conversion for most shoe brands) than what's listed on this website in Men's. It seems to me that what's listed on this shoe as the men's size should actually be the Women's size, and that the true Men's size is actually 1.5 sizes larger. Personally, I size up by 0.5 from my street shoe in the Evolv Titan, so I had to up 2 full sizes in the Defy.

Evolv, please fix your sizing! Try these shoes on and give us some logical numbers to go off of!
review.name: Shoes are fine, Sizing is off

review.reviewBody: Had an issue with sizing and exchanged them for a size up which fit me perfectly. Just got back into climbing after a few year hiatus. These shoes are neutral and work well in the climbing gym for an entry to intermediate climber. One thing to keep in mind is that the upper is suede and will stretch very little. I'm pretty consistent in a size 10 US across the board in different types of shoes but I needed these in 11.
review.name: Great entry level climbing shoe

review.reviewBody: The Defys offer the perfect combination of high-quality robustness, comfort, and stiffness for effective power transfer to climbing holds.
review.name: Best Speed Climbing Shoes on the Market!

review.reviewBody: These are great shoes for beginner climbers who are just getting started.

name: Defy Climbing Shoe

hasVariant.name: Wawona Bed Sleeping Bag: 20F Synthetic
hasVariant.description: Buy the The North Face Wawona Bed Sleeping Bag: 20F Synthetic online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Great quality and comfort! I I used it to sleep above deck on a sailboat in temperatures that went down to the 40s and 50s and was super warm. May have even been too warm at times and had to keep zipper a bit open. It is the soft and the weight is perfect.
review.name: I would definitely buy again!

review.reviewBody:
Pros: very comfortable, packs relatively small for a camping sleeping bag.
Cons: The rating is completely off. No way this is rated 20F. I'm a very cold sleeper, and camp and backpack a lot. I have never been this cold at low 40s nights. This should probably be rated 30F or higher.
review.name: Cold, but comfortable.

review.reviewBody: Great sleeping bag, took it out in high 30s to low 40s and kept me dry and warm even when my tent got a little damp. Super comfy would recommend for car camping.
review.name: I would but again.

review.reviewBody: Comfy and warm car camping classic. Fleece inner cuff by the opening is a nice touch.
review.name: Back to the classics

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought four of these for a family trip to Yellowstone. We haven't gone camping yet, but the kids have already started to sleep in their bags because they are so soft and warm! The quality is great. When scrunched into a bag, the bags are not very small, but I knew that going in -- these are for comfort, not light trekking. We are going car camping, so they are perfect for us.
review.name: Great quality sleeping bags

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Nice bag for a good price. Shipped direct from North Face quickly. Have only used once so far, on an overnight desert trip. Temps were in the 40's overnight and this bag was comfy. Plenty of room. Probably not light enough to backpack, but serves well for car camping.
review.name: Nice Economical Sleeping Bag

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a great sleeping bag, especially for tall people like myself. I'm 6'7 and i fit fully in this with extra room to nearly cover my head, overall great purchase.
review.name: Highly recommend this sleeping bag

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Beautiful AND was cozy for California desert nights in March! We love it and bought another!
review.name: Bought two and I wish I bought 3!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love the color and shape of this bag. So far I've been using it mostly for backyard stargazing but I think it'll be great for true camping
review.name: very pleased

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Plenty of room to side-sleep or flip back and forth. Keeps you warm and cozy in low temperatures. Zipper can get caught often, but not too bad.
review.name: Warm and roomy

name: Wawona Bed Sleeping Bag: 20F Synthetic

review.reviewBody: First off kudos to Castelli for this one! I was skeptical about the price tag but decided to give it a try and it was so worth it. Went on a ride when the weather started in the low 40’s and ended in the mid 60’s. description: Buy the ENVE Twin Bolt Seatpost - Zero Offset online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Twin Bolt Seatpost - Zero Offset
hasVariant.description: Buy the ENVE Twin Bolt Seatpost - Zero Offset online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This is a solid, beautiful seatpost. I have one on my gravel bike and will order another for my mountain bike. The clamp system is not your usual. It takes some fiddling to understand how it works,  but it does allow you to really make those micro adjustments to get dialed in perfectly. I wouldn't recommend for someone who changes their saddles frequently. It could be a pain. If you want to set it and forget it,  go for this seat post!
review.name: Great seatpost...I like it!

review.reviewBody: Only tightens to spec in one position if you want to change tilt you will inevitably under tighten or over tighten one of the two screws, had it 2 years still same problem, LBS (Enve dealer) mechs won?t touch it . Looks nice, well made and will hold saddle tight when toques time spec but, like I said, won?t adjust tilt with both bolts tightened to spec. Also has 2 different wedges so to be fair I guess there?s 2 possible angles to choose from. If I had to do it over again I would probably not buy. Enve has great customer service they offered to adjust for me but I do not have exact degree measurements to give them. On my own, and with others help it just has not been adjustable, luckily the preset position works well enough for me so I left it alone. Looks silky smooth on the bike :)
review.name: Clamp system sucks

name: Twin Bolt Seatpost - Zero Offset

review.itemreviewed: Camino Evo GTX Backpacking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: This is my second pair of Lowa Camino Evo GTX boots. I found these boots comfortable out of the box, with ample volume in the forefoot, firm instep flex and a grippy heel cup. I’ve used these boots for backpacking, scrambling and lots of woodland hiking and would say they have enough lateral rigidity and footbed support for difficult terrain (boulders, talus, scree) without too much weight or stiffness (compared, say, to my old Asolo Yukons). My previous pair of Camino, purchased in 1999, didn't hold up well under regular use: the toe Rand started to shred within the first hundred miles and the stitching around the decorative, V-shaped holes on the outside of the uppers gave way in year three, resulting in leakage. I plugged the leaks with shoe goo, but the holes were a design flaw—I’m glad Lowe ditched them in the current model. I hope these new ones prove to be more durable. Lowa is once again offering a relieving the USA, including resoling, so I may get these ones fixed up sooner if they start to fail, in the hope of making them last longer. I wore the previous pair out during the pandemic.
review.name: Great boot, hope this pair wears better

review.itemreviewed: Camino Evo GTX Backpacking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: These are top of the line in quality, the are as good or better as the Scarpa'a or Hanwag or Danner boots I have. For me the wide fits is perfect, but all feet are different.  I walk every day for 2 hours with dogs in the woods and these boots are great. I prefer the more robust backpacking boots, like the Camino Evo. I would always size 1/2 up, they are true to size but a bit smaller than Danner boots.
review.name: The best boot I have used so far

name: Camino Evo GTX Backpacking Boot - Men's

review.reviewBody: I bought this jacket with high hopes. I bought the size small for the extra room but it was soooooooo big. It felt like a large. It was big enough that I didn’t even bother to exchange it for a small. I just returned it. And to add salt to the wound, Backcountry charges you to return items.
review.name: Great color, terrible sizing

review.reviewBody: I bought two, a black and a blue in the last three years and looking in to get another. I wear them all winter, every day and cannot praise this parka enough. It is unbelievably lightweight and yet snug and keeps you warm. Re sizing, I am a dress size UK6 and XS is a perfect fit even with a thick jumper underneath. Nothing complicated to wash and dry. Will not disappoint. Would love to see this model in a light colour.
review.name: Parka of Parkas!

review.reviewBody:
The new Snowflake parka fits like a tent. The old fit was
so so much better. It was much slimmer fitting but not too slim. It was perfect! I don't like new fit at all!
review.name: Bring back the old slimmer fit

review.reviewBody: Bought it in Sweden and it kept me nice and warm. Love the fit and the quality of it.
review.name: Great parka

review.reviewBody: I love this jacket.  It’s super warm but lightweight and not bulky.  It fits great.
review.name: So warm!

review.reviewBody: Love my new longer length parka. It is everything I wanted. Lightweight, warm, hooded and great looking. Thank you Backcountry!
review.name: Beautiful Jacket

review.reviewBody: This coat seems of good quality. However the fit is strange with big puffy shoulders and arms. The coat is also a little longer than I expected. For reference Im 5’6”.
review.name: Too big in shoulders

name: Snow Flake Parka - Women's

hasVariant.name: Coldfront Down Jacket - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Outdoor Research Coldfront Down Jacket - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: For my commute to work in the wee hours of the cold, dark mornings! I roll the zipper down on the climbs and back up when on downhills. I love it, and I would recommend it. The arm length is suitable for biking; it stays down by my wrist, and the collar is excellent and high, but I still wear a neck gaiter.
review.name: Bike Commute Jacket

review.reviewBody:
Local company that uses recycled material where they can. 
It's a puffy jacket and will work well for me in the winter. Good amount of down. 
The only con is the cuffs aren't quite tight enough. But not a deal breaker. 
For $109, I'll have a warm winter jacket for years!
review.name: Really nice and inexpensive down jacket.

name: Coldfront Down Jacket - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Mille GTO C2 Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great compression bib.   Ended up with 1 size smaller than I usually get from Assos.  Super chamois.  Very comfortable ride.  Makes a good endurance bib short.
review.name: Excellent Bib!

review.itemreviewed: Mille GTO C2 Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: These bibs are perfect when the weather gets cooler but not cold enough for full-length bibs. They keep me warm enough but not to hot. I would purchase these again.
review.name: Awesome bibs for cooler weather

review.itemreviewed: Mille GTO C2 Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: I’ve used various bibs in the past. Decided to try these even though they were significantly more expensive. They are noticeably better.
review.name: Worth the money

review.itemreviewed: Mille GTO C2 Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: These are the most comfortable bibs I own with excellent performance. The pad on this bib is out of this world. Very comfortable but some people might find the pad a tad to thick. They would be my number one bib of choice. However, they are expensive, and while well worth it, the Castelli Premio Bib is almost as good but more cost effective. I'm 5'11", 170 lbs and take a size large.
review.name: simply elite bibs.

review.itemreviewed: Mille GTO C2 Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: These bibs were my first pair of Assos bibs. Quality is top notch, materials are high end. Extreme padding in the chamois is great for longer rides, may be overkill for 1-2 hour rides. I also have a pair of the GTS bibs and actually prefer them to these GTO's for most of my rides. I'd buy these again, but only when they're on sale. Lifetime warranty on the GTO line is a nice perk. I am 6'3", 220# and the XL in the standard length was a perfect fit.
review.name: Worth the Price for Long Rides!

review.itemreviewed: Mille GTO C2 Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: I own a handful of Assos bibs. Mostly from their lower tier. Stepping up to the high end with this one and it really is supreme comfort. I think every detail in these bibs have a high end look and feel. This is definitely a luxury item.
review.name: Really is next level

review.itemreviewed: Mille GTO C2 Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I have ridden many types of bibs over the years and have always struggled with chaffing on my right cheek when I go more then 50 miles.    Those days are gone.  The Chamois on these bibs is super thick and comfortable, it is a bit wider then most bibs and this is exactly what I needed. 
I rode 80 miles the first day I had them and no soreness at all.
review.name: Pricey but worth it.

review.itemreviewed: Mille GTO C2 Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: Wow these are fantastic bibs. I have had my other Assos bibs for about 15 years and they were tired and time to be retired.  I looked at the chamois for these bibs and was sold.  The pad must be close to an inch thick and very comfortable.  I usually have to stand up in the pedals help with circulation and my rear end talking to me but not with these bibs.  So far mostly two hour rides and the chamois is great.  Waiting to get a second pair!  You will not be disappointed.
review.name: Fantastic!

review.itemreviewed: Mille GTO C2 Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: Paid $350 for these shorts.  Wore them for two seasons.  Fewer than 1,000 miles per season on the shorts.  The front seam below the belly then came apart.  Assos and the vendor say it is no longer under warranty and cannot be repaired.  The best they can offer is $50 off a full priced replacement.  I’ve been wearing Assos bibs exclusively for over 15 years.  This is not the quality of product or level of service I expect.  I will think twice before purchasing another Assos product.
review.name: Assos doesn't stand behind its products

review.itemreviewed: Mille GTO C2 Bib Short - Men's
review.reviewBody: This bib is pretty good in term of cutting and materials used. But after trying it for several rides from 1 - 4 hours, I gotta stop use it because it’s not comfortable enough.
review.name: Good but not comfortable

name: Mille GTO C2 Bib Short - Men's
Mille GTO C2 Bib Short - Men's

description: Buy the Coleman Cascade 222 Stove online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Cascade 222 Stove
hasVariant.description: Buy the Coleman Cascade 222 Stove online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This Coleman 2 burner camping stove is a reliable choice for outdoor cooking. Its compact and lightweight design makes it easy to transport, while the wind-blocking panels ensure consistent heat even in breezy conditions.
review.name: Great camping stove!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Reliable and sturdy, solid heat output with decent real estate, we actually are using this for canning outside when we need some extra space and its convenient size and power has been a gamechanger.
review.name: Strong output adjustable burner!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I know it’s silly to call a camp stove cute, but honestly it’s so aesthetically appealing. It’s also very compact and easy to travel with. It makes me want to plan a camping trip. I haven’t used it yet but I’m going to buy fuel next time I go shopping. It never hurts to have something like this. I’m very pleased.
review.name: Cute and compact

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I received this Cascade 222 2-burner camping stove by Coleman. First I love this green color of this stove. It is very clean and easy to keep clean. Easy to travel portable carry stove. My family and I love to camp so this is perfect for quick easy meals and even making coffee! This has 2 wind guards one on each side to also then keep the lid from falling. The rack removes for easy cleaning. This is really light weight that even my youngest can carry it. I love that it has a push button igniter and the dials are easy to turn up and down for temperature. Works perfect for my family!
review.name: Perfect for my family.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is very portable and durable product. It is very easy to use. Like the ease of cleaning. Makes cooking easy. You can cook a variety of dishes.
review.name: Cooking made easy

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Wow! This stove is amazing! I’ve taken it with me twice to our campsite and it works wonders. It’s easy to set up and use. It’s pretty much a portable kitchen. It heats up quickly. A small propane tank is all you need. I love this product!
review.name: Portable stove

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Coleman cascade camping stove is a great addition to any camp lover. The use of this stove allows you to cook many other things without the use of a kitchen. It is compact enough to take with you and I love the look, so retro.
review.name: Cook it good

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This stove is really nice!  I have used many different Coleman stoves over the last 30 years.  This one is by far the best. It just feels solid.  You can also see from the pictures that it has an almost powder-coat finish.  The handle for vertical carrying/storage is also a nice touch.  The cherry on the top, though, is the electric ignition.  I am embarrassed to admit that I have forgotten a lighter on several campouts in the past.  Having electric ignition makes that moot.  Again, I cannot recommend this stove enough!
review.name: The best one yet!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This has been a game changer when it comes to camping!! It is super easy clean and heat is just right in order to cook our daily meals about the fact that the tanks last quite a bit and are very manageable when it comes to picking out how much he is needed
review.name: My new favorite

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Super easy to use. Perfect for camping or hurricane season when the electricity goes out. It also gets super hot, which is awesome for when you need high heat. The unit is also super easy to clean.
review.name: Easy to use

name: Cascade 222 Stove

review.reviewBody:
Wearing these on African safari now. Perfect choice
Pockets in all the right place and great fabric and design- I am hooked on Fjällräven
review.name: Design

review.reviewBody: With the exception of the missing internal zippered pocket  per description, can’t really complain much.  It is a Fjallraven, and I have many of their products, so I know the quality is good. Still, the missing internal pocket means I can’t put my iphone and keep it warm to avoid battery drain.  I’ll have to keep my iPhone in one of the other hand pockets.
review.name: Description slightly inaccurate

review.reviewBody: This vest is warm as liner.       I am 5’5” / 135 and a medium fits well.     I just wish there was a mesh pocket or two on the inside.
review.name: Light

review.reviewBody:
Can't go wrong with a vest that's perfect for layering, warmth, or just cute and cozy to wear around town. Love the color and large pockets.  

Ran a tiny bit small for me, but sizing up made it so it's easier to wear with a bulky sweater underneath.

Appreciate the ethically sourced down. Big fan. 
 #backcountrygearhead
review.name: Practical, cute, ethical.

review.reviewBody: Warmth without the bulk. I use it as a top layer and a mid layer in really cold weather. The pockets are perfectly placed. I feel it is a perfect addition to my capsule wardrobe.  👍🏻
review.name: Just right

review.reviewBody: Great quality product. I’m 166 cm tall and I weigh 56kg. I bought size XS, which fits me, but if you plan to wear it with more layers or your sweater is thicker or oversized you might definitely want to size up. Other than that the quality is amazing, the best is light and definitely a must have fo any season.
review.name: Size up

review.reviewBody: I'm a sucker for a good puffy vest and this one hits all the marks. Great color and cute details, responsible down sourcing and good pockets. Awesome layer piece for mountain life.
review.name: Perfect poofer

review.reviewBody: I never owned a vest before but when I tried this on I had to get it! The fit is one size too big but the XS fit me perfectly. I’m 5’7” and the cut and design is truly flattering. The goose down fill is incredibly warm and I usually wear it with a base layer and wind proof shell.
review.name: I’m not a vest person but...

name: Greenland Down Liner Vest - Women's

review.reviewBody: I've had these for just a month and a half (outside of the 30 day Backcountry return window), and the boots are already worn through.  Junk to throw in the garbage.  Very disappointing.
review.name: Dog Boots

review.reviewBody: Took a little bit of getting used to, but once she was used to them she was cruising on her walk. They stayed up, her dew claws never popped out. Highly recommend for the quick walks you must do during hot summers!
review.name: Amazing!

review.reviewBody: My little 20 pound poodle mix loves to run alongside us when we bike ride. He would rip up his paw pads pretty bad. These paired with the socks have been a life saver. You have to make them pretty tight if your dog is running so they don?t fall off and initially he did get a few blisters, but this was such a big improvement from his whole paw pads ripping off. A little pricey but seems worth it so far!
review.name: Thank god for these

review.reviewBody: Seems well constructed, fit well enough, but my build could use a slightly looser fit. Feels quite warm and wind resistant, very lightweight.

I have recently purchased several vests from leading outdoor brands.  This one is hands down the best vest!  It is well made, fits perfectly and is a very nice material.  I live in WI, and found this to be a nice layer in the winter and have worn this more than anything I have in my closet.  I am 6', 175 lbs medium build and the Medium fits perfectly.  I wish they also made one in camel color, think that would be a very nice color for these.
review.name: The best vest around!

review.reviewBody: this is my second one very warm an not bulky. excellent
Good quality, very pleased with the product highly recommend
review.name: Well, well-made

review.reviewBody: This is 3rd rogue vest. They are great spring fall and winter. Also fit nice for layering. My oldest one is close to 8years old and looks new. Great quality.

Wanted a windproof vest for an up coming 6 week fishing trip in various parts of Patagonia. It will provide the wind protection I need and the casual lodge/travel attire I want. This M size is fine worn with light shirt or 2 mid layers. Slight stretch fabric. Chest pocket was key and I really like its size. If I had to change anything it would be add zippers on hand pockets, an inch shorter in length (I am 5???10??? 163lbs) and a half inch shorter collar with microfleece liner. I understand reason behind the functional design- it???s Simms.
Do wish it came it blue!! Black is too common! Keep up the good work Simms and we will keep buying.
review.name: Superior Vest

review.reviewBody:
Great material and look however XL was the equivalent of XXXL

I AM 6’6 215 lbs and XL swallowed me I returned and will need a L at the most
review.name: Best runs very big

review.reviewBody: Fantastic. Material and fit is awesome. Love it. 6’2” 195 and L fits perfect. I don’t understand how these models on here at 6’4’ could possibly wear a M and be able to move.
review.name: AWESOME VEST

review.reviewBody: Excellent quality and very comfortable! It does run a little big, so keep that in mind. I typically wear and xl, and could have went with a L in this. I didn’t send it back because I wanted to put it to use right away.
review.name: Perfect for keeping your core warn

review.reviewBody:
My favorite vest, warm and comfortable.
Capt. Rob Approved!
review.name: Very nice vest

name: Rogue Vest - Men's

hasVariant.name: TL-BH62 Disc Brake Hose Cutter
hasVariant.description: Buy the Shimano TL-BH62 Disc Brake Hose Cutter online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This tool made cutting the brake hose and driving the spike into the hose super simple.  Just follow the instructions.  I suspect the bad reviews were maybe because one step was forgotten?  Once the hose is positioned you need to clamp the blue latch down so the hose won’t back out when the lever is moved to push in the spike.  Took less than 60 seconds from start to finish.  No mineral oil spilled.  Great tool for the job…
review.name: Great tool

review.reviewBody: The other reviews are correct: The barb press doesn't hold the hose tight enough. The hose gets pushed out of the tool and the barb doesn't go in. I didn't have any luck with the cutting tool either. I cut my hose multiple times to get a clean cut and it never did. Its better to use the cutting tool alone without inserting it into the hose clamping tool. Overall this tool didn't work at all. I don't recommend.
review.name: Doesn't Work. Don't Recommend

review.reviewBody: This made swapping the brakes on my new enduro bike a piece of cake.
review.name: Great price, easy to use

review.reviewBody:
The cutting part works fine. The barb insertion is another story. Using Shimano branded hoses this thing isn't able to hold onto the hose without the tool pushing the hose back. In every use I had to wrap the hydraulic hose in electrical tape to keep it from being pushed back.

I had much better, less frustrating results by using a tool that holds the hose like a vice - that a screw tightening mechanism.
review.name: Not a good tool

review.reviewBody: I cannot recommend this tool.  I used it for a home bike build.  The tip of blade bent after 2nd cut and clamp does not grip the hose tight enough to insert barbs.
review.name: Cannot recommend

name: TL-BH62 Disc Brake Hose Cutter

review.reviewBody: Recently did some upgrades to my single speed and decided to add this cage. It looks really cool and is pretty solid as well. It holds my bottle securely and puts a smile on my face.
review.name: Cool bike art

review.reviewBody:
Have had 2 on my gravel bike for a year. I ride an XS frame so these are mounted on my fork. They are taking a beating! I have the copper color, which I would not do again. The interior finish is rubbing off. It's not visible with a bottle installed. I love the style, but would recommend going with the silver. The bottles stay in place solidly. 
They missed the mark on the name, though. It should be called the "Swallow."
review.name: Stylish, interior finish rubs

review.reviewBody: Really love the design, but it did not work with the geometry of my bike so I must return it.  For reference I ride a small full suspension bike and it did not provide enough room or flex to get a bottle into it.
review.name: Didn't work out

review.reviewBody:
I love this cage. It's really cool looking on the bike and adds that pop of bling for sure. However it's also super functional. It fits in pretty tight corners of the frame and holds my bottles super snug on my hardtail while slamming down the gnarly stuff. 

PDW always comes with quality and it's cool to see this cage offered in unique colors. We got the rose gold to match up with a Bronze Santa Cruz frame and it pairs really well. 

I guess the sparrow flies next to the eagle?
review.name: Super sleek and functional cage

review.reviewBody: Holds my water bottle perfectly and looks great on my red and black Trek
review.name: Functional and Beautiful

name: Sparrow Cage

review.itemreviewed: Ultra Glide 2 Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody:
This sneaker is perfect for walking my 4 miles a day. I’ve tried other brands, but always come back to Salomon Ultra Glide 2. 
Just wish they could last a little longer for the $.

review.itemreviewed: Ultra Glide 2 Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: These are the only shoes that catch me when I clip a rock- they have saved me from many falls. They are so comfortable and feel springy and light on the trails. I’ve run two 50 milers in these shoes and they felt great the whole way.

review.itemreviewed: Ultra Glide 2 Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: So many running shoes through the years, my second pair of Salomons.  The best trail running shoes I’ve ever had, great quality, fit and durability.  Thank you!

review.itemreviewed: Ultra Glide 2 Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love these, I wear them almost every day. They’re so comfortable and super cute. I wish they came in a black and white

review.itemreviewed: Ultra Glide 2 Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I have worn the shoes for three or four mixed terrain runs so far. They really protect my feet from sharp gravel and handle well both on trails and on the road. Very happy with them.
review.name: Comfortable and good protection

review.itemreviewed: Ultra Glide 2 Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody:
As someone who runs trails all over CO, these shoes were made for me! With cushion in every step and just enough grip to tackle all kinds of terrain (rock, mud, gravel, even feel great on roads!). Great for long distances-I’ve put 500 miles on mine so far. Also, the only shoes that don’t hurt my knees and offer all-over support. Thanks, Salomon! 
Photo is me wearing my ultra glides in the Leadville trail marathon!
review.name: Best shoes I’ve ever owned!

review.itemreviewed: Ultra Glide 2 Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I got these on sale. They’ve been great. They’re very comfortable and durable. I would definitely buy them again.
review.name: Great value

review.reviewBody:
Extremly well engineered touring boot, which
- offers low weight and mobility for uphills
- is a (little) hard to get in and out of
- can almost match downhill performance of some alpine boots
- fits even my foot (narrow heel and wider forefoot with just heat fitting)

Overall its a 50/50 boot, if you want to go for big drops and fast freeride lines this could be a bit to "spongy" otherwise this will serve any downhill purpose. Cannot judge durability yet as I purchased mine only 1y ago. Fits great with my setup (Petzl Irvis Crampons, ATK R12 on Camox Freebirds). Overall very happy that I got it despite beeing skeptical bc of the "narrow" last.
review.name: Outstanding Touring Boot

review.reviewBody: I am 6 ft tall (190 lbs) and wear a tight 27.5. I use these all across eastern Canada backcountry skiing. Very light considering that it is fully adjustable, comfortable for the climb and a very solid boot for skiing. Definitely my go to. Love these boots!
review.name: My go to for great adventure

review.reviewBody: I have them for two years and I am really satisfied. They are comfortable and light. A little more liner support would be welcome when going down. It's a good compromise between lightness and downhill capabilities
review.name: Great boots!

review.reviewBody:
These boots are light, have excellent grip, and are perfect for going uphill. Once set to skiing position they make you really enjoy any descent at high speeds, whether off or on pist, due to their stiffness.
Moreover, the customer service is simply the best that you can get! I contacted the customer service twice in the last two years (I really like Tecnica products I must say) and they always replied immediately and provided me with the solution to my problems!
review.name: Great boots!

name: Zero G Tour Pro Boot - 2024

hasVariant.description: Buy the Pirelli Cinturato GRAVEL H Tubeless Tire online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I put about 2 seasons and 2500+ miles on this pair of tires.  I run around 30-35psi (tubeless), and see mixed gravel terrain.  I like the tan sidewall, and the tread pattern allows for reasonable use in varying conditions.  I would not push this tire very hard in a single-track/mtb situation, but that is not what this tire is for.

4 stars: the price is a bit high, but in life I’ve found that you get what you pay for.  Mass is about average for this tire.
review.name: Durable - solid gravel tire mixed use

review.reviewBody:
These are installed on Hunt Aero 34s on my Cinelli Della Strada flat bar gravel bike.  Like the Cinturato Ms, these were the easiest TL tire I ever mounted.   Thank you Pirelli!

I commute, run errands, and it's often through gravel and single track paths, so hard pack, pea or medium gravel and pavement - doing about as good in all three.  Grass is okay, not for mud and they stick well unless it's wet.  They've slid on my in turns a few times now, and not at speed.   BUT - not a single flat or leak.   Very very reliable rubber.    Could be stickier.

I do like them, just not as much as the Ms, which is my favorite all time tire - up there with Dart and Smoke from the 90s MTB race scene.  Lol.  I probably would pass on them unless on major sale now that I have had them over a year, but for the bike they're mounted on, they could not be a more perfect match.   If I sell that bike and repurpose the Hunt wheels, these tires will likely be sold off.
review.name: Fast Rolling, Look Awesome, but Meh

review.reviewBody: I have 15 years of experience in XC MTB, but have started dabbling in gravel. Supplies were short so I ended up with 35c from my local Trek shop. I'm 185lb and have ridden them at 38f/40r. Most of my road riding is for training purposes and these add so much more grip for seemingly little additional rolling resistance to my 32c tubeless Schwalbe g one road tires. I raced these cinturatos over a mix of tarmac to loose gravel and they we're surprisingly bombproof. They're fine through an occasional section of damp dirt, but I wouldn't ride them in any sort of slop. Like other reviews mention, you have to lean them pretty far before you feel the side knobs bite. If you feel comfortable handling a mountain bike you should be able to adapt to the lower profile knobs on this tire, just find a safe place to test the limits before you blindly bomb some back roads.
review.name: Impressed

review.reviewBody: I got this tire in 47mm to spend more time on CO mtb trails with my friends who mountain bike.  It’s fast and tough and will not flat.  I recently road them in a race and was floored at how well they handled road and gravel with 43lbs in them. Stable on the fast gravel sections and I got up to 42mph on the road with minimal perceptible tread buzz.  If I had to choose one tire for gravel and road, it would be this one in 40mm.  Because I do so much rough single track with friends, I need the 47mm.
review.name: Beast of a tire

review.reviewBody: Bought a set of 40s for a gravel event and they performed well. I ran them with tubes at 40 psi and didn't have any issues. Rode them through a good amount of mud and they still held the line pretty well. On the hardpack, they really shine. Would give them 5 stars, but 70 bucks is steep.
review.name: Nice but pricey

review.reviewBody: I like a gravel tire that feels fast on the road but also gives you confidence when pavement turns to dirt. Still, the fastest rolling and lightest feeling gravel tire I have ridden is the Terravail Cannonball, but the Pirelli Cinturado Gravel H is a close second. Where it does beat the Terravail is in having sexier tanwalls. The slightly darker-colored tanwalls that Pirelli uses just look so good on any bike. The center tread is very close together, and while it's not going to be quite as fast-rolling as tires like the WTB Byway or Specialized Pathfinder, it's still very quick. While I would opt for the Pirelli Cinturado Gravel M for a tire with more bite and more grip for gnarlier terrain, the Gravel H still gets the job done on some pretty rocky roads and trails. I've taken them through snow, ice, slush, mud, dirt, and various qualities of pavement and so far they've proven themselves to be worthy.
review.name: Fast rolling beauties

review.reviewBody:
I have legitimately never been so impressed with a bike tire. Over the past 5 months or so, I have put these tires through hell and have yet to see a puncture. From MTB trails, to loose/chunky gravel, to long rides on pure-gravel roads, to pavement-only rides, and more. It's also worth noting that I am a 6'3", 210lbs and I pride myself in my above-average sprint power. 

These are lighter and faster on pavement and hard-pack surfaces than most gravel tires. Oh and they also happen to be an absolute BREEZE to set up tubeless. I have truly found my "goldilocks" tire and I will not go back. 

Of course, if you are doing loads of riding in thick mud, you these will not be the best option out there. That said, I have put them through lots of mud pits and the loss of traction is really not terrible.
review.name: Absolutely awesome gravel tires

review.reviewBody: This has been a consistently fast and reliable tire. It rolls very fast and has reasonable grip for the shorter, tightly spaced, center treads. It feels soft enough at lower pressures but still feels sturdy on the side walls. I was able to mount it to my reserve wheels without tire levers. Using Muc-Off tape and sealant I had zero issues inflating and holding seal. No compressor just my Topeak floor pump with built in canister. Attached photos are on Reserve 40/44 carbon wheels. Tire shown is on 25mm internal rim.  For all out grip I would go with the Cinturato M but for a fast tire on tighter gravel this is your ticket!!
review.name: Great race tire

name: Cinturato GRAVEL H Tubeless Tire

description: Buy the Arcade Carto Slim Belt online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Carto Slim Belt
hasVariant.description: Buy the Arcade Carto Slim Belt online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I needed a new, general purpose webbing belt for outdoor activities and casual wear.  This seems to fit the bill.  My waist is around 32-33".  Male.  The manufacturer claims it will fit up to about a 40" waist.  This belt is easily adjustable.  It's a little more narrow than the standard Arcade belt at 1.25" (slim) vs. 1.50" (standard).  The slim width is good for me, since it fits in my hiking shorts that come with a narrow width belt, which aren't usually very sturdy, so I often replace them with something better like this one.

Made from mostly recycled polyester material.  The clasp is simple and appears to be sturdy.  Time will tell.  I don't get cotton anything for outdoor use, so the material is good for me.

I recommend this belt.
review.name: Great Webbing Belt

name: Carto Slim Belt

description: Buy the Portland Design Works Radbot 1000 Tail Light online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Radbot 1000 Tail Light
hasVariant.description: Buy the Portland Design Works Radbot 1000 Tail Light online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Bright, easy to attach, solid price point, and the reflective bit is a great bonus. 

This is the only one of my bike-light collection that isn't rechargeable and that's my only issue with it. I knew that going in so was prepared and did not adjust my score downwards. For me this light functions as an extra if a friend doesn't have a light for their bike and does super well in that capacity.

Always happy to buy more Portland Design Works products. I now have 10 of their lights, the Sparrow bottle cage on my girl's cruiser, and 2 of the Bar-ista Coffee Cup Holder (pro-tip: this works with the Hydroflask 16 or 22 oz tumblers with any type of beverage *wink)
review.name: Beaut' of a Rear Light

review.reviewBody: Does what a good stem should and holds the bars in place!  Have one on all of my MTB bikes (4) love the length and color options.  Really helps dialing in the fit of the bike.
review.name: Love it! Burley, light and looks great.

review.reviewBody: I needed something 10mm shorter to get the proper fit, and this does the job. Blue anodized color looks good and is cheaper than I9's stem.
review.name: It's a stem. It holds my bars.

review.reviewBody: This is my favorite stem. The machining is on par to Chromag and Thomson stems but the design and style is what makes it better. Cant go wrong with this one.
review.name: Very nice machining and quality

review.reviewBody: Really well made and a nice finishing touch for my bike.
review.name: Jewelry for my new bike

review.reviewBody: Beautiful and well made stem but the Kash Money color is more bronze than Kashima gold.  Regardless, it still looks great and functions perfectly.
review.name: Purty but not quite Kashima colored

review.reviewBody: She's been good to you. Such a loyal trail weapon. Rides like yours deserve to be rewarded. This stem is jewelry for your bike. Treat her well, and she'll return the favor! The machining on the Turbine R is both a masterpiece of modern sculpture and a perfectly functional piece of kit. It's strong, and beautiful. The top lock clamp design makes installation simple, and it's ready to go with today's more modern 35mm clamp size. It does it's job so exceptionally well that you'd forget it was there...if it weren't so pretty.
review.name: Get your steed something nice!

review.reviewBody: Colors are bright and pop, nicely machine and a great addition to the bike
review.name: Excellent stem

review.reviewBody:
The stem functions perfectly and if you buy one, expect it to do the job it's intended to without any issues! I currently own three of them and would consider buying another one if needed.

However, I do have one small complaint. For the price, the stem should come with stainless or Ti hardware like other stems in this price-point do. After a few seasons, every one of these stems I've owned  has started to show some corrosion or rust at the bolts which could be avoided with nicer hardware. That said, a few dollars later, and I've swapped all the hardware to stainless to avoid the issue going forward.
review.name: Excellent stem - I own 3
comment: Same problem here.  Where did you get SS hardware from?

review.reviewBody: Great addition to my rig. Light, looks great, exceptionally well made.
review.name: Well made and looks great!

name: Turbine-R 35 Stem

description: Buy the Dynafit Radical Alpine Touring Boot - 2023 online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Radical Alpine Touring Boot - 2023
hasVariant.description: Buy the Dynafit Radical Alpine Touring Boot - 2023 online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I got these boots to replace my current backcountry boots (Dynafit TLT8 Carbonio). I was looking for a slightly stiffer touring boot for better downhill skiing and was willing to sacrifice weight in exchange. I have always had a difficult time finding boots that fit me because I have very wide feet and a fairly large calf volume. This has been especially problematic when looking for touring boots since the majority are for low or medium volume feet. These Dynafit Radical boots fit me great. I had the liners heat molded and put in a foot beds and they're just about perfect. They're super comfortable for the uphill and ski great downhill, much better than my previous boots. The Hoji lock system is great and makes it really easy to transition. The Radical's Hoji lock system is not integrated with the top strap, but it is with the Radical Pro. This just means that you have to tighten the top strap separately, which is not a big deal at all...I'm not looking to set records in how quickly I transition. The Radical Pro's are also fairly lighter than the Radical, but this also doesn't really bother me. Bottom line is these are great touring boots with good downhill performance and perfect for those with wide feet or high volume feet.
review.name: Great boot for wide feet

name: Radical Alpine Touring Boot - 2023

review.reviewBody: This is listed as a "regular" fit but I found the size small to be quite oversized. I'm a small 90% of the time in Patagonia tops. I'm ordering an XS to see if it is a little better. The Small is oversized in a way that makes it hard to wear with baggy or wide-leg pants or tucked into high-waisted pants, but it looks great with shorts or something that's slimmer on the bottom. Admittedly, I will probably use it more for teaching, work in the sun, hiking and gravel biking, than for it's intended use as a fishing shirt... I was hesitant about the color, but it's a beautiful set of warm tones in person. Lastly, while there is a slight touch of stretch, the shirt is not as stretchy as I imagined based on the title and it doesn't seem necessary given the oversized cut.
review.name: Beautiful shirt, but fit is oversized

description: Buy the Magura USA MT7 HC3 Disc Brake online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: MT7 HC3 Disc Brake
hasVariant.description: Buy the Magura USA MT7 HC3 Disc Brake online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I run the Trail Sport SL set up on my Megatower with dual 203 rotors and my Heckler eBike I have these Limited Edition MT7's with a HC3 lever and 203 rotors. Each setup comes with an extra ferrule, plenty of hose for the install. I do recommend that you run the Magura HC Storm or MDR rotors as they are a bit thicker (2.0mm) than the standard Shimano or SRAM rotors. another benefit of the the Magura brake is the caliper pistons have magnets to hold the pads to the piston so that means no springs and no brake pad rattle for that ultimate quiet bike!  What makes the Limited Edition MT7 HC3 so much better you ask, well it's the HC3 lever.  The HC3 lever has a reach adjustment and a ratio adjustment which is not to be confused with bit point that other inferior brakes offer.  Using a Torx T25 you can mechanically change the braking power by how the lever interacts with the piston of the master cylinder.  High leverage on sticky terrain or small leverage for extended modulation.  I set mine up so the front has all the power and the rear with more modulation.  This helps control rear wheel lock up in those sticky situations.

There are two things the are of the utmost important when dealing with Magura CarboTech Master cylinders. 1. Do NOT overtighten the bolt as it will strip out the master cylinder and 2. do NOT overtighten the master cylinder bolt!!! Yeah it's the same thing but it is really that important!!!!!!

Bleeding process is pretty straight forward a small bleed kit with Magura Blood mineral oil will get the job done.  

Now i will say if you are just riding around in the parking lot and you grab a handful of lever a Code, or XT 4 pot brake are going to feel more powerful but who needs to stop in the Arby's parking lot right? Out on the trail is where the Magura shines!!! Plenty of stopping power with excellent modulation and if it's good enough for Danny MacAskill and Loic Bruni the 2021 UCI downhill world champion it's good enough for me.
review.name: Holy Stoppers Batman

name: MT7 HC3 Disc Brake

review.itemreviewed: MW702 Mountain Wide Bike Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Received these shoes as a gift from the family and was pleasantly surprised with how warm and comfy these shoes are. I wear a 42 in the XC902 and have the same size in these shoes. Wore them a several times on 2+ hour xc.gravel rides in a deluge and they did a great job keeping my feet warm and dry. Did not notice much restriction with the ankle cuff when pedaling. Wish these came with a carbon soled option as well as the sole feels pretty floppy. Boa dial is nice and easy to adjust. The velcro flap that covers the boa does a pretty good job and not as finicky to close as I thought they might be.
review.name: Keep your feet warm and comfortable

review.reviewBody: Fit avec le drap pour matelas. Doux mais peu chaud. Fait pour l'été à 18 degrés et plus.
review.name: Fit avec le drap pour

review.reviewBody: We’ve had this blanket for over 2 years. The warmth it has provided while camping AND at home, makes this blanket the best investment for your sleeping. 10/10 recommend it’s worth the price!
review.name: Most Versatile

review.reviewBody: These blankets are so great. I love my Stelar Blanket but I always wished it was a bit bigger. Now I have an Argo Blanket and it's nearly perfect. It's super light and compresses down to a small package, so I've traveled with it a bit. Also used it for car camping; threw it over myself when my sleeping bag was maybe a few degrees short of being comfortable for fall nights in the Rockies. Furthermore, I'm ok with throwing it on the spare bed for guests in the winter because I like the print and it looks good. I like that it packs down into its own pocket. This one is a keeper.
review.name: Great lightweight all-around blanket

review.reviewBody: A great, lite, comfy blanket. I've been using it for S24 camping trips. It packs down well and for the temperate climeate I live in is the best blanket. Highly recomended.
review.name: Great Blanket

review.reviewBody: Lightweight but cozy! Good addition to our camping kit.
review.name: Lightweight but cozy! Good addition

review.reviewBody: The packability really is awesome and allows for me to take it nearly anywhere I want. The warmth despite the lightweight feel is awesome and nice when it gets colder or if I don't want to bundle up. If you can get it at a lower price. Definitely worth the investment.
review.name: Traveling buddy

review.reviewBody: It's warm, comfortable and compressible it's really the perfect match for camping and keep it in the car to have it at anytime
review.name: Perfect blanket

review.reviewBody: It's great. I wouldn't backpack with it but it's amazingly soft and easily laundered for car camping. We mostly got it to save our thermarests from the dogs claws
review.name: It's great. I wouldn't backpack

review.reviewBody: Packs a punch for warmth considering its light weight.
review.name: Warm & light!

review.reviewBody: We purchased this to pair with the Vela Quilt and it keeps us warm from underneath. Only used a few times so far, but already a staple. I love that it packs up easily and has a soft texture—doesn’t feel overly synthetic. When not sleeping, it’s lightweight and is handy for adding some warmth to little and big campers alike while hanging by the campfire. The color is isn’t my favorite and super intense, but makes it easy to find at least. I also like the idea of taking this on day hikes in case of emergency…
review.name: Handy blanket

review.reviewBody: Needed a new saddle for on my trainer, it took a few of rides to get it adjusted, but once I did it was great. My old saddle would cause my shoulders to be sore no matter how I adjusted it. I gave it 4 stars because padding could be better, I wear a number of different shorts with different style pads, and I notice a difference compared to my other Fizik Aliante saddle

review.reviewBody: I have used every sale there is... well at least 25 didn't ones.  These are the best ones I have ridden.  I have three,  one for each bike.

review.reviewBody: I was comparing this saddle alongside Bontrager Aeolus Comp Bike Saddle and I just couldn't get comfortable in this Fizik saddle! Comparing the two, the Fizik is harder, has a little longer nose and is a little wider. All in all, the difference meant that, after about 30mins, I was always thinking about the pain on my backside rather than pain in my legs. Shame as I thought they look quite nice.

review.reviewBody: Excellent quality able to cinch to fit a smaller head and grow with child.
review.name: Perfect for growing kid.

review.reviewBody: I lost my grandsons old bucket hat and he was due for a  larger size.  The old one served him well for several years, and his new one is now doing the job in Hawaii.  He picked out the print and likes wearing it.
review.name: Good basic hat

review.reviewBody: We’ve had these for both kids since they were tiny and there is no better kids hat. The brim doesn’t loose shape but is flexible, they can be worn in water and washed, provide a ton of shade, just perfect!
review.name: Best kids hat!

review.reviewBody: These hats are great! You can get them wet and they have mesh up top so their heads don’t get too hot.
review.name: Love them!

review.reviewBody: great hat; fits well & has good coverage. quick arrival.
review.name: looks cute

review.reviewBody: Great hat for my 2 year old. Lightweight and good quality.
review.name: Very pleased

review.reviewBody: A must have for my kids since they were babies. They use it at the beach, at the lake, hiking, playing outside, etc! However I feel the sizing is a little off. My 5 year old wears a size L that’s recommended for kids ages 5-12, it barely fits, there’s no way that hat would fit a 12 year old. I feel like he’s gonna outgrow up quickly instead of lasting him the 7 year span it’s advertised for. Otherwise no complaints at all!
review.name: A must have

review.reviewBody: Bought both the large and XL to see what fit best. Large was too short, and XL had too much fabric in the back. Really wanted it to work as love the two mountain hardware coats I have
review.name: Large too short and XL too Big

review.reviewBody: Great vest. Keeps you warm. Material excellent and stretchy.
Great vest. Fits perfect. Stretchy and warm. high quality materials and workmanship
review.name: Best all purpose down best out there

review.reviewBody: Love that this jacket has the same zipper of the old Stretchdown Hoodie. I also love how fitted it is! I wish the hoodie had the same fit and the old zipper!
review.name: Perfect

review.reviewBody: Wonderfit fit, quality and style. A show stopper vest! I take a medium and the fit was spot-on.
review.name: Show stopper vest!

review.reviewBody: Surprised at how warm this is for how compact it is. Fits great and love the look of it as well.
review.name: Great Vest

review.reviewBody:
I loved the jacket and I love the vest even more! The jacket is my ski mid layer and general cold weather jacket. But it’s too warm most of the year in SOCAL. The vest keeps my core perfectly warm and cozy without overheating. Light weight, not overly bulky and a great tailored fit that looks casual enough to wear around town. Added to a wool or thicker flannel, I stay exceptionally warm. The inside pockets are a nice touch, the side pockets are well placed and half fleece lined,  I do wish there was a napoleon pocket like the jacket. 
I also wish the Mountain Hardware logo wasn’t screaming out in bold white as much. The rubbery raised monogram really screams advertisement. I’d prefer the MH bolt or a more toned down version. Subtle like a Patagonia label. 
Overall my new favorite clothing item!!
review.name: Mountain Hardware did it again!

hasVariant.name: Front Range Insert
hasVariant.description: Buy the MSR Front Range Insert online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
In a word: Excellent.

I've used this on about 6 trips at this point, and it works exactly as described. Light, easy set up, durable. Slightly roomier & lighter than the 'mid design that we've all see for the last decade, with better separation between the rain fly & bug mesh.

This past weekend, the bathtub bottom was put to the test as a torrential downpour gave us almost 1" in a half hour, which overwhelmed the natural drainage of the campsite and left standing water under the tent pads. I woke up, put my hand on the floor of the tent, and it was like a waterbed. No leaks or seepage, everyone's gear stayed dry. Can't think of a better test than that.
review.name: Simply: Excellent.

review.reviewBody:
The insert its self worked great. however, the first time I used it the Adjustable 
Collapsible pole by MSR poked a whole through the top of it. 
that same pole worked great when just using the shelter its self without the insert.
review.name: MSR adjustable pole.

review.reviewBody: I love this insert. So lightweight and easy to set up!
review.name: I love this insert. So

review.reviewBody: I purchased both this and the rain fly shelter to match for a 4 day backpacking trip in Desolation wilderness in Northern California. The insert is like a regular tent. The pockets are small on the sides but I used the accessory pole (5 foot recommended) and hung my small lantern from it. There's a tone of room so you can fit everything you cary and you can change in the tent just fine. You have to keep the pole at about the second notch to make it tight and there a bit of a nuance for the stakes and getting everything set up right - not a big deal though. Set up was easy, but keep in mind, you have to pick a spot generally larger than those that already have rocks cleaned because of the stakes and its size. Once you're all set up with the rain fly on, it's pretty nice, warm and keeps the wind away. CAUTION. There were a couple windy nights on my trip - if the outer fly isn't nearly touching the ground, you'll get a ton of dust inside. The wind will come in from the bottom of the fly and carry with it a lot of dust landing all over your protected gear and face inside the tent. If you worry about the pole in the center, don't. After the first night, you don't even notice and it sits in there pretty tight. Even if you bump it, it doesn't shift too much. Also, in the Desolation wilderness there are many spots with just flat rock. Think about where you'll be camping mostly when buying this tent. Either stake it down or get creative with wrapping rocks on the stake lines. Overall the design is fun, it's unique, and I enjoyed it.
review.name: Backpacking in Desolation wilderness California

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have had a lot of wear on these! And I can honestly say they are an average boot. They are extremely warm, look very nice, but not very comfy as they feel almost slanted, and they do not stay tied up!! Meh.

review.reviewBody:
These are perfect boots for snowshoeing. With the rubberized base and the one-piece tongue to keep snow and water out, no fur lining to attract snow and no extra insulation, your feet actually are dry and stay dry. The base is also stiff enough to hold the snowshoe straps without letting them dig into your foot. 
Outside of snowshoeing, they are flexible to walk around a bunch and are super cute. 
I got the brown and love the blue laces and found them true to my regular size.
review.name: Cute, comfortable and innexpensive

review.reviewBody:
They won't stay up at all.  The top slips down rendering the knee pad useless.  On my last ride with they slipped down immediately after pulling them up, so I ignored it just to finish the ride.  Aaaaand I crashed, cut my knee up bad.  One job and they failed when I really needed it. Will try to return this garbage.  

Side note: I did wash them twice and followed the directions (cold water, hang dry).
review.name: Worked fine for about 5 rides, but now..

review.reviewBody:
It's hard to love wearing knee pads, but when picking lesser of evils these are a solid choice.

Are they comfortable?
- In general yes. They warm up and flex nicely, so on climbs they don't rub or press very much. 

Do they stay in place?
- Yes, thank God! I'm 5:9, 160 lbs and went with size S. For me they stay in place well, and I don't have to pull them up at all on long descents. This is clutch and much better than my downhill POC pads. 

What do I use them for?
- I'll wear them at the bike park or on long shuttled trail rides. I live in NorCal, so I'd say that Downieville is the perfect place for these pads. Long descents with some climbs in between is no problem. I would not wear them; however, on long days with equal climbing and descending. This is not begrudging these pads in particular, but on those types of rides I just prefer to take my chances without pads.
review.name: Nobody loves pads, but these are good

review.reviewBody: Fitted in January of 2024, initially liked the feel and thought I would have plenty of trouble free riding. After 1,800 miles the rear was shredded and there was hardly any black left. Front was going that way too. I am used to getting 3,000 - 4,000 from Specialized or Continentals so this was a major disappointment. Would not recommend.

review.itemreviewed: Corsa N.EXT G2.0 TLR Tubeless Tire
review.reviewBody: I been using these tires for long time due to its competition performance.
review.name: Excellent competition tire!

review.itemreviewed: Corsa N.EXT G2.0 TLR Tubeless Tire
review.reviewBody:
I bought this tires with concerns and reservations that the Details section on this site described the tires to be "Road tire suited for training regimens and Saturday group rides".   Ive done tons of weekend rides + 2 century rides since Feb and here is my take:

-- In terms of overall feel... These seem VERY inline with Conti Grand Prix or Pirelli offerings... a bit more comfortable but also just a smidge slower.     
-- Ride is one of the better i've tried with its stability at higher speed descents(>30Mph) 
-- Wet handling is fantastic
-- On the other hand, these tires are seem to have the puncture resistance that I want for the long hauls.  I just did a 50 mile + ride where two other folks I rode with had punctures.. my Vittorias were fine. 
-- Downside is that they are a PAIN to get over the rim.  The bead is made of some crazy material mix.     I was able to get one of the tires mounted but had to take the other tire/rim into the shop. 
-- Other downside is that the bead needed considerable break in time via distance (approx 80 miles of riding) to get seated properly and get the sealant fully distributed,  During the early miles, I was losing a large amount of air out of each tire after 6-8 hours.   However, I now only have to add 10psi or so per week.
review.name: Think the "Details" aren't quite right..

review.reviewBody: This will be the second full season running this pack. By and large, I enjoy it. I think the pack is well constructed and the airbag system is reliable. My biggest complaints is the adjustability of the waist, however looking at it from a safety perspective, it makes sense. In that area though, a large improvement could be made by having a larger center buckle that can more easily be manipulated with gloves on. It would also be great to see this made in a larger size, as splitboarding and snowmobiling are gear intensive and packing for either does become a bit tetris-y to get everything to fit. But overall, I really enjoy this bag and think that it serves it's purpose well.
review.name: Overall good pack

review.reviewBody: After 2 seasons the Soelden 32 avy bag is now useless. Regardless of how much or how little I pack into the interior space, the zipper that holds in the avy balloon itself continuously splits open. This zipper is designed to open when the avy balloon inflates…but it comes open regularly throughout the day. Time to find another bag unless Osprey does a zipper redesign.
review.name: Avy zipper opens - poor zipper quality

name: Soelden Pro Avy 32L Airbag Backpack

hasVariant.name: Strive 16 MN Binding - 2025
hasVariant.description: Buy the Salomon Strive 16 MN Binding - 2025 online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: The retro look on this binding is cool but the boot to ski transfer is fantastic
review.name: Great boot to ski transfer

review.reviewBody:
This new binding and specifically the toe piece is the result of Salomon looking to improve not regress. It offers excellent compatibility with the various toe lug shapes so it saves a lot of hassle and confusion when it comes to potentially picking another boot down the road. 
The toe offers an excellent blend of the elastic travel the STH toe was known for, but a similar lateral stiffness to the Warden MNC toe. Basically power transfer meets smooth sailing. It is slightly lower than the Warden toe stack height so you get the benefit of better snow feel on wider skis as well.
review.name: Well thought out upgrades!

review.reviewBody: The new strive 16 brings the same confidence and performance of the MNC but is lighter and seems like its a bit more connected to the ski.  The binding skis flat, without any noticeable toppling forward feeling.
review.name: Great improvements

review.reviewBody: After getting a sneak peak and a couple days on the Strive 16 near the end of last winter. I really enjoyed skiing it on the all new QST 106 and comparing it to my older 106. The new strive I get a better on snow feel as I am closer to the ski and closer to the snow. The thing I love about all Salomon bindings is how easy it is to step in and the sound it makes. Once I am clipped I know I am ready for a fun time in the trees, bumps, park, groomers.
review.name: Closer to the Ski Closer to the Snow

review.reviewBody: dependable salomon product. feel confident when in extreme conditions.
review.name: light and streamline look

review.reviewBody: This binding has changed ski feel for me. It offers a very close to ski feeling and power transfer is exceptional. The strive manages to achieve this in such a lightweight and durable package, it will be my binding of choice for years to come due to it's superior ski feel and elastic travel.
review.name: Elastic Travel is the name of the game

review.reviewBody: I’m not easily contained… but they held me down. Finally, some security in this unsecured world.
review.name: They held me down

name: Strive 16 MN Binding - 2025

review.reviewBody: Comfortable shoe for long rides, decently stiff sole, easy to get in and out of. I love the no-tongue design, and the boa closure is nice. Even though the shoes fit properly, It seems like I can't actually get them tight enough, but that seems to just be the nature of the flexible material, and not an issue with the boa. Solid shoe overall, very comfortable, decent performance but just not stiff enough to feel like an aggressive shoe. If you're looking for a starting point with cycling shoes outside of spin class, this is a good option with a low price point.
review.name: Solid entry-to-mid level cycling shoe
