review.reviewBody: It is very well constructed, and very well designed.
review.name: Great backpack

review.reviewBody:
I bought this bag recently as a solution to my space issues with other camera bags. This bag is the perfect size for bigger jobs. I'm a freelance photographer who does a lot of weddings and always found myself carrying multiple bags & feeling super weighed down. This bag fits my Nikon D850 with two lenses + 2 different film cameras perfectly- and the best part is that it leaves room for my laptop, external hard drives, chargers, tripod, water bottle & all the miscellaneous items I might need for a job. It is so great to finally have a bag that can fit everything I need. The origami style padding is genius, and I don't feel nervous about the safety of my lenses. The fact that the zippers are designed so you can sling the bag around for easy access while on the go is honestly so helpful & not a feature I thought I would use as much as I do.

A feature that I also really appreciate is the removable padded pod. It's perfect for when I'm shooting on a location where I don't want to be carrying around a large backpack the entire time & I also love the option to take it out and create more space if I needed for a weekend trip. There are so many pockets, I feel like every time I use the bag I discover a new one. I'm so happy to finally have pockets for keys, ear buds, wallet etc. rather than having to chuck everything in one big pocket. This makes me way less fearful of losing/leaving my belongings behind. 

The bag feels pretty durable. I will say it is relatively heavy even without anything in it, but that is to be expected with how much padding & how many pockets this bag has/not something I mind as the straps are super comfortable. I also wish the side pockets would be a bit deeper/better suited for water bottles, I definitely need a carabiner clip to keep my bottle secure & if I'm packed to the brim I'd sacrifice bringing a bottle that does not have a top I could clip (thermos) because it would certainly fall out.

I'm super happy with this bag and am excited to continue using it- hopefully for the rest of my life! Finally, as a super bonus, this bag just looks so incredibly cool. Thanks Thule!
review.name: Super Practical & Durable

review.reviewBody:
I bought this pack specifically for the camera portion. I travel for work have to bring a Canon R5 along with me. I pack a RF 15-35 on the camera and keep a RF 28-70 f2.0 up above (absolutely huge lens). I have my Macbook Pro and iPad in the available pockets. It is super tight when I have the cover on my iPad getting it in and out, but both computer and iPad are protected. I love the ability to put my (PD travel tripod) in the exterior side pocket and secure it with the strap. I do wish only one side of the pack had the tripod pocket and the other side was better suited for water bottles. My former pack (DSPTCH) had a perfect set up for this, but had the opposite problem of not carrying a tripod well. I always have a YETI Yonder or Rambler Bottle with me.  

Quality build overall, I'm not too worried about how this will hold up on my travels. The zippers seem a bit light especially when forcing the back panel closed with both iPad, Laptop and camera gear. Time will tell.

Oh, I absolutely love the mesh top pocket ... it is magnetic / zippable pocket, so easy in and out for my Airpods, gum...etc. Stays closed with the magnet along and the mesh overlaps as well.
review.name: Getting the job done!

review.reviewBody:
The rear flap that holds the laptop was not completely thought out. When the flap is fully opened, a laptop will overcome the strength of the velcro and fall out. The laptop zipped compartment is nicely padded but when a laptop is in place it is really tough to close the rear zip if you have packed a camera in the main compartment. There needs to be a bit of a gusset and a better safety snap or clip to ensure the laptop is secure. The flat metal hooks used in other parts of the bag would be a great solution in this spot. (I am using a MacBook Pro 14 inch)

The removable sling bag is terrific and side access to the camera is well thought out. The roll top flap is excellent for storing a jacket and I like the hook closure. It is secure and will not deteriorate as velcro would.

The sewn strap on the back of the bag that is intended to slide over the handle of wheeled luggage is too tight. You cannot slide it over most handles. It needs some slack. The feature is really handy, so I was disappointed that it would not fit over my wheeled bag.

I like how the waist strap can be stowed cleanly, but I would prefer a slightly beefier waist strap since most women will find that bearing the weight on the waist rather than the shoulders is far more comfortable. The current design is a bit flimsy and the buckle could be a bit beefier too.

The side pockets intended to hold a water bottle are too snug and too short. If you put a water bottle in that space it will fall out. They need to be wider and taller to prevent the bottle from falling out. It would be ideal to have a loop sewn into the bag so the top of a typical steel/aluminum water bottle, like a Kleen Canteen, could be clipped at the top with a carabiner.

Overall, the appearance of the bag is appealing and streamlined. The materials seem to be of high quality and the form factor is nice. However, I think that the bag was designed with cosmetics in mind and some of the details like the mis-sized or insecure spaces were not tested with a full bag. I find it difficult to believe that this was tested with a typical traveller’s inventory of goods. That said, the removable sling bag and camera access details are excellent.
review.name: Great features... but would love a couple of fixes

review.reviewBody: i primarily purchased this for travel.  i had a two week trip to hawaii, 3 islands and lots of activity.  i loved the storage, pockets and ability to expand.  while on each island i was able to quickly downsize and just use the camera pod.  it fit everything i needed!  i love the quality as well.
review.name: great backpack for travel

name: Covert Camera 32L Backpack

review.itemreviewed: Speed Fusion Web Sport Sandal - Women's
review.reviewBody: I can walk all day very comfortably in these sandals. The sole is very good on uneven terrain
review.name: Very comfortable sandals

review.itemreviewed: Speed Fusion Web Sport Sandal - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought these during the summer and upon try on there were multiple sharp seams that were digging all around my foot, I ended up melting them with a lighter to smooth them out. The hard plastic triangles hit right at my bones now matter how I adjusted them, I ended up wrapping with several layers of bandage to add some cushion. I also thought they were pretty slippery when wet, my feet would slide around even though it was properly tightened, I think maybe having a toe strap would help add a little more stability? The soles remained wet for a long time afterwards and were slippery that whole time. What I do like is that the soles are very comfortable, I was able to hike quite a distance and still felt like I had a bounce in my step! They grip well on different surfaces and the material did not show signs of wear. I also really like the custom fit you can get with how adjustable it is, makes it great if you're in between sizes.
review.name: Comfortable with modifications

review.itemreviewed: Speed Fusion Web Sport Sandal - Women's
review.reviewBody: So comfy and took zero breaking in. These are made to fit perfectly.
review.name: BUY THEM!

review.itemreviewed: Speed Fusion Web Sport Sandal - Women's
review.reviewBody: Possibly it is just the shape of my feet, but I cannot wear these without the hard triangles digging into my ankle, extremely uncomfortable and unfortunately will pass them on. I bought these online but suggest maybe potential buyers try them on first. I have never had a problem with other Merrell shoes - always been a big fan.
review.name: Extremely Uncomfortable Speed Fusions

review.itemreviewed: Speed Fusion Web Sport Sandal - Women's
review.reviewBody: So comfy the minute I put on! Quality looks good and I hope they hold up as well as my previous Merrells.
review.name: Comfortable and quality

review.itemreviewed: Speed Fusion Web Sport Sandal - Women's
review.reviewBody: Flattering on foot. Most comfortable sandal - great for lots of walking on pavement or beach and good on medium or wide foot.
review.name: Perfect sandal and support

review.itemreviewed: Speed Fusion Web Sport Sandal - Women's
review.reviewBody: Clean up well, if you get them wet or in muddy terrain.
review.name: Love these outdoor shoes!

review.itemreviewed: Speed Fusion Web Sport Sandal - Women's
review.reviewBody: Very nice cheap sandals.  The webbing on the straps around the ankle are not great, and kind of itchy.  It is a minor annoyance, but important for someone with tactile issues.  I hope they wear down shortly.
review.name: straps are itchy

review.itemreviewed: Speed Fusion Web Sport Sandal - Women's
review.reviewBody: Love these sandals! They are very comfortable and look great. Fit true to size.
review.name: Amazing!

review.itemreviewed: Speed Fusion Web Sport Sandal - Women's
review.reviewBody: When I first put them on it felt like I had imagined, this is what cleats must have felt like.  That said after a couple of days, I was having trouble not not liking them.  My feet felt free, and I must be watching my posture for they no longer feel sticky while I am walking.  That is always good.
review.name: The shoes helping me shop

name: Speed Fusion Web Sport Sandal - Women's

review.reviewBody: The hat gives great protection from the sun. I normally have a hard time finding hats that fit me and this one fit nicely (I got the XL). The color was a light cream. I'm very happy with this purchase.
review.name: It gets the job done

review.reviewBody: I recently took this hat with me on a trip to Hawaii, and it exceeded all my expectations. It packed perfectly into my luggage without losing its shape, and it was an absolute lifesaver both on the beach and out on the boat. The black and white string adds a sleek, minimalistic touch, making it stylish without being over the top. What really stood out to me was the attention to detail-the logo was perfectly centered, giving it a clean and polished look. The brim had the ideal balance of structure-sturdy enough to hold its shape in the wind, but flexible enough to be comfortable and not overly stiff. Whether I was lounging by the water or enjoying the sea breeze on the boat, this hat was the perfect combination of functionality and style. I couldn't recommend it enough for anyone looking for a versatile, well-made hat for any outdoor adventure.
review.name: I would definitely purchase this again

review.reviewBody:
These slings are great. At 12mm wide, they're a little bulky for alpine draws (at least compared to other dyneeema options out there), but for tethering, rap extensions, and anchors, they're great. They handle well and knots don't weld nearly as badly as most thin dyneema slings do. 

In response to the other review on this page, these slings are rated to 23 kN. I'm not sitting in front of my Sterling slings right now to see whether or not the tag states that. If not, well, they should. Either way, all it took was a quick visit to the Sterling website to confirm that they are indeed rated. That review should be removed, it's pointless. They're strong and safe as could be.
review.name: 23 kN rating

review.reviewBody:
Usually Sterling means good quality but it says it is made from Dyneema but no CE/UIAA certifications are mentioned and the MBS rating (in Kn) is not specified.
Maybe this is a Backcountry fail but you can find other slings that are certified for climbing by the CE/UIAA.
review.name: Why is the MBS rating not specified?

description: Buy the Wild Country Friend Cam Set #0.4-3 online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Friend Cam Set #0.4-3
hasVariant.description: Buy the Wild Country Friend Cam Set #0.4-3 online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Absolutely love these cams and the friend series. Love the extendable draw on them, allows for more uses and saves on quick draws!

Used regularly for single and multipitch climbing. These cams are great for anyone new or experienced in trad climbing. I loved that the sling could be adjusted even a little bit for extra extension, and the quality is excellent. Make sure when buying you know the best gear for your purposes, as the offset or zero friends could be a better choice. For an all purpose rack, these are my go to. Love using these.
review.name: Classic, reliable, well made

review.reviewBody: ima be real with ya, they are cams. they will catch you when placed well. theres not much else today, its a tried and true product and it keeps me alive, thats all i can ask for
review.name: Hey look... im not dead

review.reviewBody: They’re good

Good solid construction without being too bulky. I really love the extendable sling since sometimes I just need a little extra length, and adding a draw would either be too much, or I just don't want to bring a dozen extra draws up the wall with me.
review.name: Smooth Action & Extendable Sling

review.reviewBody:
These are a fantastic addition to my rack.
I like these as an alternative to Black Diamond’s C4 as they are very similar in sizes and come with the added bonus of extendable sling and less weight. The extendable sling is short and do not replace the alpine on my rack but they add a margin of safety by allowing you to extend to avoid a feature that may cause your draw to unclip.
review.name: My Best Friends

review.reviewBody: Easy to place, love how they hang high on your rack but you extend them for placement
review.name: light weight and efective

review.reviewBody: Great set of cams. The reason I have chosen these are the ability to extend the base sling if necessary, eliminating a few cases where and extended draw is necessary, allowing for easier use. More versatility than most cams.

Pros 
- extendable sling helps with rope drag and walking when your low on draws/slings
-reasonably priced
- Lighter then BD C4s but not as light as other options.

Cons
-I found the cam lobes exceptionally difficult to pull back when you are pumped and redlining on at limit climbs 
-Cam sizes are mildly larger then of other brands in the same colors.

All in all a hammer is a hammer and they will get the job done.
review.name: Gets the job done

review.reviewBody: These are great cams that are lightweight, and super bomber. The extendable sling is a huge winner, and I love them. This pack also makes them great for building your first rack!
review.name: Best All Around Cams

name: Friend Cam Set #0.4-3

review.reviewBody: I love this shirt. Based on previous reviews, I ordered a size smaller than my usual. Even after going a size down, it still has a nice oversized fit. I have issues with sleeve length being too short, but not with this shirt. I would like to buy it in more colors. The waffle texture is great, too!
review.name: Great Lightweight Overshirt

review.reviewBody: I love this color and comfort!
review.name: My favorite new piece!

review.reviewBody: Bought to wear with leggings and crop top for fall. Big and comfy.
review.name: So cozy and perfect for fall

review.reviewBody: I always purchase women’s XL. 38DD. But this was WAAAYY TO BIG. Sleeves way past fingertips. I’m going to size down 2 sizes & hope it doesn’t shrink. I am SUPER ANNOYED I have to pay to ship back & pay for shipping for the new size. I probably won’t ever buy here again because of it but I love the shirt color & fabric sooo….
review.name: HUGE- And I mean HUGE

review.reviewBody:
I like this shirt but the Medium could be an XXL. I will wear it around the house as more of a shacket with another shirt underneath because I don't want to pay to return. 

Normally I wear a large and if I ordered again I'd consider a XS. It's that big.
review.name: size down 2 sizes - this is

review.reviewBody: This shirt has been in heavy rotation since I bought it about a month ago. It's a great lounging around/cozy autumn layering shirt. Like the reviews say, it runs pretty large, but I like the oversized fit (think: wearing a men's large). Medium probably would have fit me too & been loose and comfy.
review.name: Cozy overized shirt

review.reviewBody: It is very cute and soft however when I first put it on I thought they had accidentally sent me an XL. It was a medium just as I had ordered. I am 5’9 135 pounds and I normally wear a medium in flannel sweater or jackets. Even rolling up the sleeves I was still drowning in it. Not sure what I will do if I will try to exchange for a small or just return (don’t want to pay shipping again)
review.name: Cute and soft but HUGE

review.reviewBody:
This runs huge. It’s soft and stretchy and so comfortable but definitely size down 1-2 sizes. I am tall with a broad athletic build and larger chest. For reference, I prefer a mens size medium for my flannels because women’s tend to run too narrow for me. The size small in this shirt is very large on me. 

I could size down to an xs (unheard of for me) but the sleeves would probably be too short after a few washes and it’s comfy this big. If you are a thin narrow person, I would size down no less than two sizes or you will be swimming in this.
review.name: Almost Perfect

review.reviewBody: Great material and cozy but I would say definitely listen to the comments and consider going 2 sizes down. I usually order M or L with jackets. I ordered a small and still have to roll the sleeves up and keep pulling up the shoulder since it falls down.
review.name: SO LARGE
